overview: Pondicherry (also known as Puducherry or Pondy) is an enclave city within Tamil Nadu, India, noted for its strong French colonial influence on architecture, Mediterranean‑style houses and boulevards, and a blend of Eastern and Western cultures. Tamil is the main language, while English is widely understood and some French is still heard among older residents.
bestTimeToVisit: No specific season is mentioned in the source; the city can be visited year‑round.
topAttractions: Scenic drive along East Coast Road
travelTips: Hire a scooter or bicycle for local travel (≈₹300–₹500 per day) as streets are narrow and pedestrians have right‑of‑way
Use PTDC tourist buses for economical city tours
Auto‑rickshaw rides from the bus station to the French Quarter can be bargained to around ₹50
Cheapest bus from Chennai to Pondicherry costs about ₹150–₹280
Carry identification and a small cash advance (≈₹500) for two‑wheeler rentals
English is widely understood; basic Tamil phrases are helpful
